resources.string: Welcome to Music Mania, your seamless music streaming app!

This activity will display a list of songs available. 
I have used a set of hardcoded dummy data to display the list of songs for now. Will be accessing songs stored in the device Music Player. 
I have also added dummy Toast messages to OnClick events for each of the list items. 
On clicking each item in the list, the corresponding song will be played. 
The user will have the ability to "play", "stop", "pause" and "shuffle" the songs.

This activity will display a list of artists and albums corresponding to the songs available. 
I have used a set of hardcoded dummy data to display the list of songs for now. Will be changing it later. 
On clicking each item in the list, a new activity with artist and album details will be displayed. 
For now I have added intents ONLY FOR FIRST THREE artists. The other intents will be added later for other artists.

This activity will give the user ability to search a song/artist/album from the list available. 

The user can enter the name of the song/artist/album and the appropriate search results will be displayed.

This activity will provide the ability to the user to browse songs and buy them. 

I will use an implicit intent to connect to Google Play Store and browse songs. 

It will be possible to add selected songs to "cart" and proceed to set up payment and then pay. 

The Set Up Payment button will lead to Payment activity.

Focus will be on setting up payment method for buying music online. 

I found two APIs for setting up payments- Google Pay API and Stripe API- have not worked with either of them. 

I have decided to use the Google Pay API (https://developers.google.com/payments/setup) for setting up payments through my music player app. 

Setup is straightforward enough- adding gradle dependencies. Tutorial found here: https://developers.google.com/payments/tutorial.
